intro: Zephyranthes goiana, commonly known as the Brazilian rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are strap-shaped and evergreen, providing a lush appearance throughout the year. Zephyranthes goiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom in seasonal rains.
